findings.title: Brute Force Attack Detected
findings.description: Multiple failed SSH login attempts (over 100) from IP 192.168.1.100 to server web-01. Attack pattern suggests automated brute force attempt.
findings.recommendation:
1. Block IP 192.168.1.100 in firewall
2. Enable account lockout policy
3. Review SSH configuration
4. Implement fail2ban

findings.title: SQL Injection Attempt
findings.description: SQL injection pattern detected in web application logs. Attempt to inject ' OR '1'='1' -- into login form parameter.
findings.recommendation:
1. Implement input validation
2. Add WAF rules for SQL injection
3. Review application code
4. Enable prepared statements

findings.title: Outdated Apache Version
findings.description: Apache HTTP Server running version 2.4.49 which has known vulnerabilities. Current secure version is 2.4.58.
findings.recommendation:
1. Update Apache to version 2.4.58
2. Apply security patches
3. Schedule regular updates
4. Monitor for vulnerabilities

findings.title: Weak Password Policy
findings.description: Password policy allows passwords less than 8 characters and doesn't require complexity. 15 user accounts found with weak passwords.
findings.recommendation:
1. Enforce 12-character minimum
2. Require special characters
3. Implement password expiration
4. Enable MFA

findings.title: Missing Security Headers
findings.description: Web application missing security headers: Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options.
findings.recommendation:
1. Add CSP header
2. Add X-Frame-Options: DENY
3. Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
4. Add Referrer-Policy

findings.title: Unencrypted Database Backup
findings.description: Database backup files stored in /backups directory without encryption. Contains sensitive PII data.
findings.recommendation:
1. Encrypt backup files
2. Restrict access to backup directory
3. Implement backup encryption policy
4. Monitor backup process
